messages.title: Kate Hoey Calls For Responsible Pub Rules
messages.content: Kate Hoey MP has welcomed steps to improve night-time drinking while supporting responsible pubs through difficult times.

messages.title: Kate Reveals Local Health Boost
messages.content: Health Services have improved dramatically for Vauxhall residents, recent research by Kate Hoey MP reveals.

messages.title: Kate fights for local pool facility
messages.content: Kate has always championed sport and exercise for everyone, particularly children since long before she was an MP.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support for responsible pubs during difficult times while taking steps to control night-time drinking.
Improvement in health services for Vauxhall residents based on recent research.
Continued support for sports and exercise, with a focus on advocating for everyone, particularly children.

issues.economy: Labour's frozen council tax for Lambeth residents for the second consecutive year; while Lib Dems and Tories raised council taxes by 40%.
issues.health: Health services have improved dramatically for Vauxhall residents.

housing.content: Labour's frozen council tax for Lambeth residents promotes better economic conditions for homeownership and living in the area.

images.caption: Kate discussing pub matters with local landlord.
Kate opening the Garden of Life at Kennington Days Garden Unit.
Kate at the Old Lilian Baylis School in Kennington where her support is securing its conversion into a Community School.
Thank goodness Labour's frozen council tax. Families like ours couldn't afford another 40% Lib Dem tax hike.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet details Labour's success in freezing the council tax in Lambeth for that year, contrasting it with the 40% increase by Lib Dems and Tories in other years. It also emphasizes Labour's efforts against crime, suggesting a drop in crime since Labour was elected and criticizing the opposition for being soft on crime.
